page.title: 13Gold - Strath Of Kildonan
page.content: Gold is found in most of the tributaries of the Helmsdale River. In 1868 gold was discovered in the river and by the end of the year there were five hundred gold prospectors in the Strath! Many of them lived in wooden huts at Baile an Or (Gaelic for the town of gold) They found considerable amounts of gold. After two years the landowner forbade any prospecting because of complaints from farmers and sportsmen. The Kildonan gold rush was over! Nowadays many tourists come to look for gold. To pan for gold you put soil or gravel together with water into your pan and swirl them round. After repeated washings the heavier minerals lie in the bottom of the pan and if you are lucky you will find gold there. Gold panning is an interesting pastime but you need time and patience.
